message: What is the capital of France?
The capital of France is Paris. It's one of the most visited cities in the world!
Who wrote 'To Kill a Mockingbird'?
The book 'To Kill a Mockingbird' was written by Harper Lee. It’s a classic!
What is the square root of 64?
The square root of 64 is 8. Simple math, but very useful!
What is the chemical symbol for water?
The chemical symbol for water is H2O. It’s essential for life on Earth.
Who painted the Mona Lisa?
The Mona Lisa was painted by Leonardo da Vinci. It’s an iconic masterpiece!
What is the largest planet in our solar system?
The largest planet in our solar system is Jupiter. It’s truly massive!
How many continents are there on Earth?
There are seven continents on Earth: Africa, Antarctica, Asia, Europe, North America, Oceania, and South America.
Who discovered penicillin?
Penicillin was discovered by Alexander Fleming in 1928. It revolutionized medicine!
What is the capital of Japan?
The capital of Japan is Tokyo. It's a bustling metropolis and a cultural hub.
What is the smallest prime number?
The smallest prime number is 2. It's the only even prime number!
What year did the Titanic sink?
The Titanic sank in 1912 after hitting an iceberg on its maiden voyage.
Who is known as the Father of Computers?
Charles Babbage is known as the Father of Computers for his pioneering work on the Analytical Engine.
What is the longest river in the world?
The Nile River is considered the longest river in the world, stretching over 6,650 kilometers.
What is the formula for the area of a circle?
The formula for the area of a circle is πr², where r is the radius.
Who developed the theory of relativity?
Albert Einstein developed the theory of relativity, changing our understanding of space and time.
What is the speed of light?
The speed of light is approximately 299,792 kilometers per second. It's the universal speed limit!
What is the capital of Australia?
The capital of Australia is Canberra. It’s a planned city and the political center of the country.
What is the freezing point of water in Celsius?
The freezing point of water in Celsius is 0 degrees, the temperature at which water turns to ice.
What is the largest mammal in the world?
The largest mammal in the world is the blue whale. It can grow up to 100 feet long!
Who invented the telephone?
The telephone was invented by Alexander Graham Bell in 1876. It revolutionized communication.
